diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient had severe angioedema while on the DPP-4 inhibitor sitagliptin without an ACEI. Normal C1-INH levels and function, along with a heterozygous Thr328Lys mutation in the coagulation factor XII gene, support the diagnosis of type III hereditary angioedema. The severity of this episode was considered uncharacteristic and likely exacerbated by sitagliptin.
